docs.snippet: Breads Bakery is offering a sturdy variety of matzo balls for the holiday, either in soup or plain.
France will toughen rules on hate speech to ensure social media giants do more to remove racist and anti-Semitic content from internet, Prime Minister Edouard Philippe said on Monday.

headline.print_headline: France to Get Tougher on Social Media Hate Speech-PM
headline.main: France to Get Tougher on Social Media Hate Speech-PM

docs.snippet: The leader of Britain's opposition Labour Party, Jeremy Corbyn, apologized on Sunday for anti-Semitism within his party, as he faced the prospect of protests over a perceived failure to act on such incidents in the past.

headline.print_headline: UK Labour Leader Corbyn Apologizes for Anti-Semitism in His Party‍​
headline.main: UK Labour Leader Corbyn Apologizes for Anti-Semitism in His Party‍​

docs.snippet: An Ohio man locked up in Atlanta faces a new charge after prosecutors say he posted a video online of himself using a contraband cellphone.

headline.print_headline: Feds: Inmate Posted Video Online Using Contraband Phone
headline.main: Feds: Inmate Posted Video Online Using Contraband Phone

docs.snippet: A whistleblower at the heart of a Facebook data scandal on Monday questioned the result of Britain's 2016 Brexit referendum as his lawyers presented evidence that they said showed the main campaign for leaving the EU had broken the law.

headline.print_headline: Whistleblower Questions Brexit Result, Says Campaigners Broke Election Law
headline.main: Whistleblower Questions Brexit Result, Says Campaigners Broke Election Law

docs.snippet: EU leaders on Thursday urged social networks to guarantee transparent practices and fully protect personal information as pressure piled on Facebook after allegations that data from 50 million of its users was mishandled.

headline.print_headline: EU Leaders Tell Social Networks to Guarantee Users' Privacy
headline.main: EU Leaders Tell Social Networks to Guarantee Users' Privacy

docs.snippet: Brazilian prosecutors on Wednesday said they had opened an investigation into whether London-based political consultancy Cambridge Analytica acted illegally in Brazil, as controversy over the firm's data harvesting practices spreads across the glo...

headline.print_headline: Brazil Prosecutors Open Investigation Into Cambridge Analytica
headline.main: Brazil Prosecutors Open Investigation Into Cambridge Analytica

docs.snippet: A prosecutor said the pictures a North Carolina man posted on Facebook of his dead wife and daughter are enough proof to show he is guilty of murder.

headline.print_headline: Man Who Posted Photos Online of Dead Wife and Child on Trial
headline.main: Man Who Posted Photos Online of Dead Wife and Child on Trial

docs.snippet: Volatility in U.S. equity markets this year is pushing investors not only to invest in stocks abroad, but also to commit their money to an even more foreign place: the hands of stockpickers rather than index funds.

headline.print_headline: Globalists Buck U.S. Index Fund Trend
headline.main: Globalists Buck U.S. Index Fund Trend

docs.snippet: An Egyptian court on Tuesday ordered authorities to revoke the operating licenses of the Uber and Careem ride-hailing services and block their mobile apps and software.

headline.print_headline: Egyptian Court Rules Uber, Careem Illegal; Appeal Expected
headline.main: Egyptian Court Rules Uber, Careem Illegal; Appeal Expected
